intro: Anistylis lutea, commonly known as the yellow star grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green inflorescences that are clustered at the tips of the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as fields and wetlands. Anistylis lutea is typically perennial and can form dense vegetation in suitable environments.
